name: Kesar Milk
history: Kesar Milk, also known as Saffron Milk, is a traditional Indian drink. It's cherished for its health benefits and is often consumed during festivals and special occasions.
description: Kesar Milk is a warm, soothing beverage made with milk infused with saffron (kesar), and often sweetened. It's known for its rich aroma and health benefits, including improved digestion and relaxation.

instructions.title: Infuse the Saffron
instructions.description: Soak the saffron strands in a tablespoon of warm milk for a few minutes to release their color and aroma.

instructions.title: Boil the Milk
instructions.description: In a saucepan, bring the milk to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer.

instructions.title: Add Ingredients
instructions.description: Add the soaked saffron along with its milk, sugar, and cardamom powder to the boiling milk. Simmer for another 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Pour the Kesar Milk into a cup and garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios. Serve warm.

tips: The longer you soak the saffron, the more pronounced its color and flavor will be.
Adjust the amount of sugar based on your taste preferences.
variations: Vegan Kesar Milk: Use almond milk or coconut milk instead of dairy milk.
Masala Milk: Add a mix of ground nuts and spices like fennel for a different flavor.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat gently before consuming.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave, stirring well.
presentationTips: Serve in traditional Indian glasses or clay cups for an authentic experience.
Garnish with a few strands of saffron on top for a luxurious touch.
